note.p: Education: St John's College, Cambridge (MA fil. nob. 1631)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB (son's entry); Venn

Notes: The election date is Fane's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected and admitted into the Society on 1 October 1662.
Hunter suggests FRS could be the dramatist Francis Fane (1635-1691) instead. Venn has a Francis Fane admitted to Emmanuel College Cambridge in 1653 and later admitted at Gray's Inn in 1655.
